words.definition: fluent or persuasive in speaking or writing
words.example: She gave an eloquent speech that moved the audience.

words.definition: a typical example or pattern of something; a model
words.example: The company is seen as a paradigm of commercial success.

words.definition: having knowledge or awareness
words.example: The team was cognizant of the risks involved in the project.

words.definition: present, appearing, or found everywhere
words.example: Mobile phones have become ubiquitous in modern society.

words.definition: lasting for a very short time
words.example: The ephemeral nature of fashion trends makes them difficult to follow.

words.definition: open to more than one interpretation; not having one obvious meaning
words.example: His response to the question was ambiguous and left everyone confused.

words.definition: showing great attention to detail; very careful and precise
words.example: She is meticulous about keeping records of all transactions.

words.definition: producing much fruit or foliage or many offspring; producing many works, results, etc.
words.example: Shakespeare was a prolific writer, creating 37 plays and 154 sonnets.

words.definition: dealing with things sensibly and realistically in a way that is based on practical considerations
words.example: We need a pragmatic approach to solving this problem.

words.definition: representing the most perfect or typical example of a quality or class
words.example: The film is considered the quintessential example of 1980s action movies.

words.definition: well meaning and kindly
words.example: A benevolent smile crossed her face as she handed out gifts to the children.

words.definition: accorded a great deal of respect, especially because of age, wisdom, or character
words.example: The venerable old building had stood in the town center for over 300 years.

words.definition: the occurrence and development of events by chance in a happy or beneficial way
words.example: Finding that rare book while looking for something else was pure serendipity.

words.definition: intended for or likely to be understood by only a small number of people with a specialized knowledge or interest
words.example: The professor's lecture was full of esoteric terms that confused many students.

words.definition: sweet or musical; pleasant to hear
words.example: Her mellifluous voice made the lullaby even more soothing.

words.definition: to recognize the full worth of something
words.example: I really appreciate your help with this project.

words.definition: resulting in good; favorable or helpful
words.example: Regular exercise is beneficial for your health.

words.definition: the feeling or belief that one can rely on someone or something; firm trust
words.example: She has great confidence in her abilities.

words.definition: having or showing care and conscientiousness in one's work or duties
words.example: He was a diligent student who always completed his homework on time.

words.definition: to increase or improve in value, quality, desirability, or attractiveness
words.example: The new features enhance the user experience of the app.
